message.content:
cs.NI, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.IT

The paper deals with network management and uses a learning approach based on Case-Based Reasoning (CBR) to find solutions for Bandwidth Allocation Models (BAMs) in a network scenario with dynamic traffic profile. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses the use of similarity functions in the learning process, which suggests the sub-categories cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also deals with decision-making in a dynamic environment, which suggests the sub-category cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper deals with the configuration of network parameters, which suggests the sub-category cs.IT (Information Theory).
